verses.verse: Better <S%H2896><s%> is a dry <S%H9164><s%> morsel <S%H6595><s%> and quietness <S%H7962><s%> with it Than <S%H4480><s%> a house <S%H1004><s%> full <S%H4392><s%> of feasting <S%H2077><s%> with strife. <S%H7379><s%>

A servant <S%H5650><s%> who acts <S%H7919><s%> wisely <S%H7919><s%> will rule <S%H4910><s%> over a son <S%H1121><s%> who acts <S%H954><s%> shamefully, <S%H954><s%> And will share <S%H2505><s%> in the inheritance <S%H5159><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> brothers. <S%H251><s%>
The refining <S%H4715><s%> pot <S%H4715><s%> is for silver <S%H3701><s%> and the furnace <S%H3564><s%> for gold, <S%H2091><s%> But the Lord <S%H3068><s%> tests <S%H974><s%> hearts. <S%H3820><s%>

An evildoer <S%H7489><s%> listens <S%H7181><s%> to wicked <S%H205><s%> lips, <S%H8193><s%> A liar <S%H8267><s%> pays <S%H238><s%> attention <S%H238><s%> to a destructive <S%H1942><s%> tongue. <S%H3956><s%>

He who mocks <S%H3932><s%> the poor <S%H7326><s%> reproaches <S%H2778><s%> his Maker; <S%H6213><s%> He who rejoices <S%H8056><s%> at calamity <S%H343><s%> will not go <S%H5352><s%> unpunished. <S%H5352><s%>
Grandchildren <S%H1121><s%> are the crown <S%H5850><s%> of old <S%H2205><s%> men, <S%H2205><s%> And the glory <S%H8597><s%> of sons <S%H1121><s%> is their fathers.

Excellent <S%H3499><s%> speech <S%H8193><s%> is not fitting <S%H5000><s%> for a fool; <S%H5036><s%> Much <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> less <S%H637><s%> are lying <S%H8267><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> to a prince. <S%H5081><s%>

A bribe <S%H7810><s%> is a charm <S%H68><s%> <S%H2580><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of its owner; <S%H1167><s%> Wherever <S%H413><s%> <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> he turns, <S%H6437><s%> he prospers. <S%H7919><s%>

He who covers <S%H3680><s%> a transgression <S%H6588><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> love, <S%H160><s%> But he who repeats <S%H8138><s%> a matter <S%H1697><s%> separates <S%H6504><s%> intimate <S%H9017><s%> friends. <S%H9017><s%>

A rebuke <S%H1606><s%> goes <S%H5181><s%> deeper <S%H5181><s%> into one who has <S%H995><s%> understanding <S%H995><s%> Than <S%H4480><s%> a hundred <S%H3967><s%> blows <S%H5221><s%> into a fool. <S%H3684><s%>
A rebellious <S%H4805><s%> man <S%H4805><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> only <S%H389><s%> evil, <S%H9563><s%> So a cruel <S%H394><s%> messenger <S%H4397><s%> will be sent <S%H7971><s%> against him.
Let a man <S%H376><s%> meet <S%H6298><s%> a bear <S%H1677><s%> robbed <S%H9599><s%> of her cubs, <S%H9599><s%> Rather <S%H408><s%> than a fool <S%H3684><s%> in his folly. <S%H200><s%>
He who returns <S%H7725><s%> evil <S%H9567><s%> for good, <S%H9186><s%> Evil <S%H9567><s%> will not depart <S%H4185><s%> from his house. <S%H1004><s%>

The beginning <S%H7225><s%> of strife <S%H4066><s%> is [like] letting <S%H6362><s%> out water, <S%H4325><s%> So abandon <S%H5203><s%> the quarrel <S%H7379><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> it breaks <S%H1566><s%> out.

He who justifies <S%H6663><s%> the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> and he who condemns <S%H7561><s%> the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> Both <S%H1571><s%> <S%H8147><s%> of them alike <S%H1571><s%> are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

Why <S%H4100><s%> <S%H2088><s%> is there a price <S%H4242><s%> in the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> to buy <S%H7069><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> When he has <S%H369><s%> no <S%H369><s%> sense <S%H3820><s%>?
A friend <S%H7453><s%> loves <S%H157><s%> at all <S%H3605><s%> times, <S%H6256><s%> And a brother <S%H251><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> for adversity. <S%H9567><s%>

A man <S%H120><s%> lacking <S%H2638><s%> in sense <S%H3820><s%> pledges, <S%H8628><s%> <S%H3709><s%> And becomes <S%H6148><s%> surety <S%H6161><s%> in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of his neighbor. <S%H7453><s%>
He who loves <S%H157><s%> transgression <S%H6588><s%> loves <S%H157><s%> strife; <S%H4683><s%> He who raises <S%H1361><s%> his door <S%H6607><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> destruction. <S%H7667><s%>

He who <S%H6141><s%> has <S%H6141><s%> a crooked <S%H6141><s%> mind <S%H3820><s%> finds <S%H4672><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> good, <S%H9185><s%> And he who is perverted <S%H2015><s%> in his language <S%H3956><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> into evil. <S%H9567><s%>
He who begets <S%H3205><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> [does so] to his sorrow, <S%H8424><s%> And the father of a fool <S%H1><s%> has <S%H5036><s%> no <S%H8055><s%> joy. <S%H3808><s%>
A joyful <S%H8056><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> is good <S%H3190><s%> medicine, <S%H1456><s%> But a broken <S%H5218><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%> dries <S%H3001><s%> up the bones. <S%H1634><s%>
A wicked <S%H7563><s%> man <S%H7563><s%> receives <S%H3947><s%> a bribe <S%H7810><s%> from the bosom <S%H2436><s%> To pervert <S%H5186><s%> the ways <S%H734><s%> of justice. <S%H4941><s%>

Wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the one who has <S%H995><s%> understanding, <S%H995><s%> But the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> are on the ends <S%H7097><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
A foolish <S%H3684><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> is a grief <S%H3708><s%> to his father, And bitterness <S%H1><s%> to her who bore <S%H4470><s%> him.
It is also <S%H1571><s%> not good <S%H2896><s%> to fine <S%H6064><s%> the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> [Nor] to strike <S%H5221><s%> the noble <S%H5081><s%> for [their] uprightness. <S%H3476><s%>

He who restrains <S%H2820><s%> his words <S%H561><s%> has <S%H3045><s%> knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> And he who <S%H7119><s%> has a cool <S%H7119><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%> is a man <S%H376><s%> of understanding. <S%H8394><s%>

Even <S%H1571><s%> a fool, <S%H191><s%> when he keeps <S%H2790><s%> silent, <S%H2790><s%> is considered <S%H2803><s%> wise; <S%H2450><s%> When he closes <S%H331><s%> his lips, <S%H8193><s%> he is [counted] prudent. <S%H995><s%>
